summary: endless list of Good Omens AUs (4/?) Anthony J. Crowley & Miles Maitland: Crimson & Obscene [on AO3] “Lottie will be closed. How...
caption:
endless list of Good Omens AUs (4/?)

Anthony J. Crowley & Miles Maitland: Crimson & Obscene [on AO3]

“Lottie will be closed. How about the Ritz?”

Adam Fenwick-Symes’ suggestion was addressed to his gaggle of wealthy misfit compadres and, like a bomb going off, the damp London street they were all walking down was instantly echoing with a string of complaints.

Miles Maitland, walking arm-in-arm with Agatha Runcible, objected most vehemently of all, exclaiming, “Oh, talk sense, darling! Not while I’m dressed like this.”

Truthfully, it was a fair objection. All of them (save Adam, who had been misinformed) were dressed like they had just stepped out of an upper-class pajama party – which, in fairness, they essentially had – and it wasn’t exactly standard procedure to waltz into the Ritz wearing anything less than one’s best.

But, given that Adam asked, “Well, have any of you got a better idea?” to which no responses arose, they all wound up clustered around a table at the Ritz, anyway. Garishly dressed or not, they were still all renowned patrons (or the children of such, at the very least) and, as such, they were hardly going to be turned away.

Oh, what could be the harm, really? Surely those beastly journalists have better things to do at two in the morning than loiter about every spot in town, just in case we may show up.

Such were the thoughts that ran through Miles’ head as they were all escorted to Nina Blount’s usual table and, after consuming around half a bottle of champagne all on his own, the possibility of ending up on the cover of the Daily Herald was the very last thing on his mind.

“This is all too dull,” he harrumphed after draining the dregs of his champagne flute. Having already shed his fur cloak, he made a point of dropping his nightcap onto Adam’s head as he rose to his feet, nearly knocking over his chair in the process.

“Well, how do you propose we remedy the dullness?” Nina asked, amusedly batting at the fuzzy little ball at the end of the nightcap now poised upon Adam’s head, and Miles grinned not unlike a cat on the verge of purring.

“With music, darling!” he professed, gesturing to the piano on the other side of the dining room which, at this time of night, was missing its usual pianist. “I have a strange longing to play something crimson and obscene.”

“Are you sure that’s wise?” Adam asked, to which Agatha, already giddy at the prospect, promptly retorted, “What could be wiser?”

Winking at his adored partner-in-crime, Miles turned promptly on his heel and started forward for the piano – only to, in his tipsy haze, walk straight into a taller gentleman with a shock of red hair and a pair of oval sunglasses perched upon his nose, the lenses an even more brilliant shade of the colour.

“What was it he said about ‘crimson and obscene’?” Nina tittered back at the table while Miles, rather flustered by the sudden obstruction of his path, fluttered about.

Read the full chapter on AO3 / fic playlist

blog.name: they-handed-me-the-moon
blog.title: They Handed Me The Moon
blog.description: Paige, 23, she/her, queer. This blog is for whatever catches my interest, which for now is primarily Good Omens

summary: One excellent bit in Good Omens that I missed the first time is this part when  they’re driving back to their places after...
body:
One excellent bit in Good Omens that I missed the first time is this part when  they’re driving back to their places after realizing Warlock isn’t the antichrist:

[Crowley] rummaged in the glove compartment, fumbled a tape at random, and slotted it into the player. A little music would …

… Bee-elzebub has a devil put aside for me, for me …

“For me,” murmured Crowley. His expression went blank for a moment. Then he gave a strangled scream and wrenched at the on-off knob.

“Of course, we might be able to get a human to find him,” said Aziraphale thoughtfully.

It struck me as odd at first because I know that Aziraphale gets lost in his own head, but flat-out ignoring Crowley’s scream seems like a bit much. Only he didn’t, did he?

Because immediately before this, they were giving up. They weren’t discussing how to stop the apocalypse or how it might come about, they were discussing the means by which it “will happen.”

But then Crowley screams in visceral terror at the punishments he will undoubtably face, and Aziraphale doesn’t embarrass him by drawing attention to it, he just goes “well NEVERMIND guess we’re coming up with a new plan then.”

Because stopping Armageddon is about saving humans and fast cars and sushi, but its a big ask and maybe it’s best to just go on trusting heaven like one has always done? Sometimes an angel just needs to realize that his demon friend suffering in hell is simply Not An Option before he can really throw off the last of his inhibitions.

And his determination never really falters after that, does it?

summary: Theory that the creators of the show read Good Omens and connected with Crowley so hard that they decided to go full wish...
question: Theory that the creators of the show read Good Omens and connected with Crowley so hard that they decided to go full wish fulfillment and make him the top he thinks he is in the book.
answer:
What you are suggesting here, my love, is that Crowley is one of the executive producers/show runners and he is having the time of his life writing this absurd fanfiction of him and his favorite angel. All the while, Azira remains none-the-wiser because so long as Crowley doesn’t forget to drop by for their nightly dinner, he leaves Crowley to whatever meddling he’s doing.

That is what I am getting here.

Animator. Pansexual fandom blogger, Indie creator of Filipino LGBT+ projects.

summary: Even if Good Omens does not provide sexual or romantic tension between Crowley and Aziraphale (though I figure we’ll certainly...
body:
Even if Good Omens does not provide sexual or romantic tension between Crowley and Aziraphale (though I figure we’ll certainly interpret it that way), consider: 

Asexual aromantic tension between two male-shaped beings in a loving queerplatonic life-partnership (which, even in my early days, is how I always pictured their relationship given the nature of angels as outlined in the book)

blog.name: brainlicking
blog.title: art blog whoo!
blog.description:
G'day, this is the art blog of S Rosengaard. I am a graphic novelist who is in the process of creating my first story. 

Contained within will be copious amounts of content featuring my original characters, and less copious amounts of fanart. 
FAIR WARNING, gore and body horror art are unflinchingly posted here.


(I don’t take requests, but if you inbox something interesting, I may (or may not) draw it during my free time.)

tags: I MIGHT draw my interpretation of their human-shaped bodies
I had fun colouring this hahaa
summary: I felt like designing my interpretations of the Eden!forms for Aziraphale and Crowley from Good Omens!  Firstly for Crowley I...
caption:
I felt like designing my interpretations of the Eden!forms for Aziraphale and Crowley from Good Omens! 

Firstly for Crowley I wanted to give him multiple eyes as a remained of the times where he used to be an angel, and of course horns for his current demon status.

For Aziraphale, since he’s the guardian of the eastern gate, I wanted to give him a dawn-like colour palette and starry skin, as the sun rises in the east.

(open picture in new tab to get in the details)

✧ tip jar ✧ RedBubble ✧  Etsy ✧

trail.content_raw:
I felt like designing my interpretations of the Eden!forms for Aziraphale and Crowley from Good Omens! 

Firstly for Crowley I wanted to give him multiple eyes as a remained of the times where he used to be an angel, and of course horns for his current demon status.

For Aziraphale, since he’s the guardian of the eastern gate, I wanted to give him a dawn-like colour palette and starry skin, as the sun rises in the east.

(open picture in new tab to get in the details)

✧ tip jar ✧ RedBubble ✧  Etsy ✧
trail.content:
I felt like designing my interpretations of the Eden!forms for Aziraphale and Crowley from Good Omens! 

Firstly for Crowley I wanted to give him multiple eyes as a remained of the times where he used to be an angel, and of course horns for his current demon status.

For Aziraphale, since he’s the guardian of the eastern gate, I wanted to give him a dawn-like colour palette and starry skin, as the sun rises in the east.

(open picture in new tab to get in the details)

✧ tip jar ✧ RedBubble ✧  Etsy ✧

blog.name: they-handed-me-the-moon
blog.title: They Handed Me The Moon
blog.description: Paige, 23, she/her, queer. This blog is for whatever catches my interest, which for now is primarily Good Omens

tags: he still ends up facing the truth EVENTUALLY
and until then tends to sort of drift aimlessly in its direction
but if he doesn't want to see it he drags his heals real hard
summary: As I make my first stumbling attempt at writing Good Omens fic, one thing I am discovering about the Crowley in my head is that...
body:
As I make my first stumbling attempt at writing Good Omens fic, one thing I am discovering about the Crowley in my head is that he is very bad at thoroughgoing self-deception, (he always asks the right questions in spite of himself), but he is so good at alternate explanations and caveats that he is able to hold himself at arm’s length from uncomfortable truths.

And part of that genuinely is him avoiding things he doesn’t want to face, but part of it is an endless low-key anxiety spiral that results in his overanalyzing every possible option and being terrified of making the wrong choice.

For example, I vacillate on whether “sauntered vaguely downward” is a reliable description of Crowley’s fall because the narration throughout Good Omens tends to minimize the trauma of his experiences, but it does make sense for the Crowley I imagine. Because hell is right to say something is wrong with heaven, and Crowley knows it, but that Satan fellow seems like a right bonehead, and does he really want to get himself involved in this mess? So he never truly takes a stance with hell, neither quite faces the ugliness of either option, but when the lines are drawn he just sort of finds himself a bit more on the side of hell, without ever having admitted to himself that he’d made up his mind.

Similarly, when he meets Aziraphale he sort of knows right away that he likes this angel and wants to spend time with him, but for all he knows this is heaven playing a trick on him, or just a bit of lingering nostalgia for his old life, and anyhow Aziraphale made it clear that he is on the side of Good and believes that Crowley can only be Bad, so that’s that. But they keep spending time with one another regardless, and Crowley is sort of aware that he’s doing it on purpose, that he likes doing it, but whenever he comes close to really admitting the significance of that he spirals into a million excuses and alternatives. Then one day it hits him that they’re proper friends, have been for ages, and that he cares for Aziraphale. And that’s terrifying on any number of levels, he’d never have made up his mind to put himself in such a position, but then he went and did it anyway while he was distracting himself with excuses.

Basically, whereas Aziraphale has one foolproof explanation (ineffability) that keeps him from facing uncomfortable truths, Crowley does see the uncomfortable truth and buries it beneath every alternate explanation under and over the sun. 

And then eventually the truth becomes too glaring to ignore so he just throws hands and goes the fuck to sleep.
